result.execSummary:
The defendant Michele M Buehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$2500-$5000], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the victims, DHG DOB: 9-14-61 & RP DOB: 6-12-55, or Peopleserve Inc.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michele M Buehler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Nadya E. Perez-Reyes.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Representative from Peopleserve also present in court; State is in compliance w/victims rights.  Agreement reached. State moves to amend charge to Felony Theft, Take & Carry Away, 943.20(1)(a)&(3)(bf).  Discussion re proposed amendment; Court expresses concern re facts of case but reluctantly allows amendment. Def waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions def and accepts waiver.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Victim requests to be present for court hearings

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E. Perez-Reyes.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim present in court.  Counsel waiting for offer and req adj.   Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Court req State to file any victims rights info prior to sentencing.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.
No contact with People Serve Inc; L.P.; DAG dob 9/61; RP dob 6/55

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya Perez-Reyes of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty  for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $2500 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver. SPD will represent.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
